text.tspan: Setup
Place START CARD in center of table.
This is the first card of the MAP.
Shuffle remaining cards to form the
DRAW DECK.
Deal 3 cards from the DRAW DECK to
each player to form a HAND of cards.
Choose the starting player.
Player with most 'R's in their name
if you can't otherwise agree.
Each player also has a SCORING
PILE (initially empty) to track
points.
Each Turn
1) Choose 1 card from your HAND and
connect it to the MAP.
2) Score the card that was just added to
the MAP (see “Scoring" card for details).
3) Draw 1 card from DRAW DECK
into your HAND (to bring it back up
to 3 cards).
For each point earned, take 1 card
from the DRAW DECK and add it
to your SCORING PILE.
If no cards can connect to the MAP,
then place a card from your HAND
in the smallest SCORING PILE
amongst those of your opponents.
End of Game
Game ends immediately when the last
card is taken from the DRAW DECK.
If the last card is drawn while
scoring and there are not enough
cards for the full amount, then
that's really unfortunate, isn't it?
Player with the most cards in their
SCORING PILE wins.
In case of a tie, argue for a bit before
playing another game to determine the
real winner.
A RESOURCE will score 1 point for each
PIRATE it is directly connected to.
A PIRATE will score 1 point for each
PORT it is directly connected to.
A PORT will score 1 point, plus 1
additional point for each matching PORT
or RESOURCE it is connected to.
PORTs can connect through
other PORTs when scoring.
Tortuga (on the Start Card) is both
a PIRATE and a PORT that matches
any RESOURCE.
If there are multiple resources on the
card, score each one separately.
Scoring
Connections
A DIRECT connection is one that does
not pass through any PORT or PIRATE.
DIRECT connections are required
when playing a RESOURCE or a
PIRATE card.
A connection may not pass through a
PIRATE.
PORTs can connect through other
PORTs when scoring:
Even through Tortuga, the PIRATE
PORT.
Even if the PORT resources do
not match.
